reviews.text: we had two rooms here, we were made very welcome, room was clean and comfy, the usual standard of premier inn, bathroom was a little small but perfectly ok. The reception was not the greatest, a bit tired, and the car park was not great, but the value for money was great, and the food was great, so were the staff, it was fine for the one night but its not one of the best ones for the same money
reviews.title: its fine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tom, Matty, Phil, Steve and Emma made the 1 night stay I had with my partner an absolute gem. The room was perfect and warm, Housekeeping did a wonderful job in keeping the room clean. I can't understand why people would make complaints about this premier inn, you couldn't hear a noise and the beds were superb and made me fall asleep as soon as my head hit the pillow. The whole reception team should be praised for their work and I shall definitely stay here again. Thanks Tom and Matty for a wonderful 1 night stay
reviews.title: Treated Like Royalty

reviews.text: The usual clean and tidy standards you expect from premier inn, however didn't sleep well due to the room being very hot, even though it wasn't a warm weekend, also the room was quite dark and dingy. Breakfast was good, and it was a good base for Blackpool. I am a fan of Premier Inns but wouldn't stay at this one again.
reviews.title: Ok stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night we found the room spotless and everything needed for a comfortable stay, The service was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was excellent and also good value served with a smile
reviews.title: Friendly service excellent value

reviews.text: Did exactly what it said on the tin! Food was mediocre but reasonably priced. Bed and room very comfortable but nowhere to sit comfortably if there were two of you. A bit of traffic noise but nothing to keep you awake. Every member of staff I came across was friendly and helpful. Would use this hotel again.
reviews.title: Comfortable and clean with welcoming staff.

reviews.text: stayed for one night in a twin room which was spotless.
reviews.title: faultless with very friendly helpful staff.

reviews.text: friendly staff and the breakfast was 1st class.
reviews.title: Place to stay just outside Blackpool

reviews.text: great value.
reviews.title: blackpool trip

reviews.text: High standards and friendly staff. Good value for money, family room very spacious with childrens play area in closed fencing. Warning, don't trust your Sat Nav on the post code, its takes you half a mile down the road from Blackpool.
reviews.title: Premier inn preston

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: cheap deals are what its all about.
reviews.title: Good value, good food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been regular visitors to Premier Hotels and can't fault the facilties or the staff. They are all outstanding, and tend to all your requirements. The only thing I would question is the lack of a telephone to cope with emergencies!
reviews.title: Wherever you go Premier stands out above all other value for quality and value

reviews.text: Room clean, service good, but Restuarant has a fly problem, most noticed in the evening.
reviews.title: Travel Lodge is Good, but Restuarant has flys

reviews.text: Enjoyed stay, very courteous and welcoming staff at reception and breakfast area.They have either been taught well or comes naturally.
reviews.title: not a modern building but good old fashioned hospitality

reviews.text: A warm welcome, good accomodation and value for money meal deal.
reviews.title: A good experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although not one of the newest Premier Inns, this one was clean and comfortable. The adjacent pub had great value food and a reasonable atmosphere. We did not have breakfast so cannot comment on that. The only issue we had was the lack of mobile phone signal, at least on O2, T-Mobile and Three. Could only use a mobile when standing out in the car park. You have to pay for wi-fi in the room but you can get it free in the pub, which is useful. Out-of-town location was ideal as it is only a few minutes out and also a short drive to a large Morrisons supermarket. Plenty of free parking on site.
reviews.title: Good value but in a mobile phone dead zone

reviews.text: Have stayed here a few times on business. Standard Premier Inn with attached pub/restaurant where breakfast is served. Staff are always very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Good Choice for Preston Area

reviews.text: Hotel is a few miles outside of Preston, on the Blackpool Road. If you are travelling from Preston, then get ready to turn right when you reach the opposite filling station, otherwise you may overshoot! This can be tricky during rush hours!
reviews.title: Always good

reviews.text: Rooms are great, very clean, have a big double bed and a nice Samsung 22" LCD TV with a good range of freeview channels.
reviews.title: You would probably drive past, but don't

reviews.text: True, rooms at rear will be quieter than the front facing rooms.
reviews.title: Smokin - Room smelled like a stale ashtray

reviews.text: The attached Lea Gate pub offers good value meals. Please see attached photo for list of special offers. A word of warning though, if you are there on a Monday, make sure you order your free sweet when ordering the main meal as you cannot add it on after for some reason best know to themselves. Annoying when there is a big poster stating "free sweets on a Monday". As ever, always read the small print!
reviews.title: excellent choice of hotel
